import { React, useContext, useState } from 'react'; import './game.css'; import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom'; import { gameContext } from './GameProvider'; import './modal.css'; export default function Normal(props) { const navigate = useNavigate(); const context = useContext(gameContext); const WORD_LIST = ["abcde",'apple','awful','pizza','dizzy','quick','crazy', 'jelly','joker','equip','about','anger','china']; let answer = WORD_LIST[Math.floor(M)] let game_state = context.game_state; const keys = document.querySelectorAll('.key:not(.delete,.enter)'); let space = document.querySelector('.guess:not(.used)'); console.log(keys); keys.forEach((key) => { key.addEventListener('click', onClick_key); }); function goback() { navigate(-1); } function onClick_rule() { navigate('/rules'); } function onClick_unable_change() { setModal(!modal); } const [modal, setModal] = useState(false); function onClick_key(e) { let value = e.target.innerText; space.innerText = value; space.classList.add('used'); } return ( <>
Hard mode:
{modal && (

Hello Wordler!

You can only change the level before game start!

)}
); }
